reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Arrived in compact packaging; obviously for the price you have to put it together, at most 30 mins to put it together by yourself. Recommend installing the screw on both sides of chair back and tightening both in increments until tight to be even on both sides. When I assembled mine, the left arm is slightly higher than the right. Unsure if this is due to how I tightened them or if manufacturing defects. Really comfy! Has built in lumbar support. The headrest just stretches around the top of chair. Don’t tighten anything extremely tight as most of the pieces are plastic and can crack with use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gaming Bliss: Unleashing Comfort with best office
reviews.reviewText: I recently upgraded my gaming setup with a [Gaming Chair Brand] gaming chair, and the experience has been nothing short of extraordinary.From the moment I sank into its plush cushions, I knew this chair was designed with gamers in mind. The ergonomic design provides exceptional lumbar support, ensuring long gaming sessions are not only enjoyable but also comfortable. The adjustable armrests and reclining feature add a customizable touch, allowing me to find the perfect position for intense battles or casual gaming.The attention to detail in the construction is evident. The chair's sturdy build and quality materials give it a premium feel that stands out. The sleek design and stylish accents not only enhance the overall aesthetic of my gaming space but also make a statement.What truly sets this gaming chair apart is its functionality beyond gaming. Whether I'm working, streaming, or simply relaxing, this chair adapts effortlessly, proving to be a versatile addition to my home office.In conclusion, the [Gaming Chair Brand] gaming chair is a game-changer. It combines comfort, style, and functionality seamlessly, making it a must-have for any gaming enthusiast. Say goodbye to discomfort and hello to gaming bliss with this exceptional gaming chair.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good enough for price
reviews.reviewText: I bought this chair after my old one gave out, mostly because of the style and the price tag associated. It is a build it up yourself, and the parts seemed fairly adequate in quality. The fabric isn't really leather, more of a plastic type covering over foam. One of the arm rests already had a split in it which was not reassuring for longevity. The assembly itself wasn't too bad, the most trouble I had was getting the last few screws in place for the backrest, holding it in place while trying to thread the screw was slightly irritating. All in all, doesn't seem to be too bad of a chair, as a 6', 220lb man it supports me well and I can recline in it without feeling like it is going to drop me on the floor. It is fairly comfortable though the back support feels unnatural at first but I got used to it as I reclined and generally relaxed in the chair as I used my PC.Long story short: good enough for the money you pay for a stylish, somewhat comfortable chair.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Red is my favorite color. Product As advertised. Only thing i dont like is the mounting bolts that go underneath the seat i think some washers can be used but thats just my opinion. Head rest cushion might be a little uncomfortable well for me it did feel uncomfortable so all I did was place it behind the head rest. Everything is included and I say this because before purchasing this chair i read some of the reviews and one of them stated that it didnt come with mounting screws ect… All in all satisfied

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works amazingly for the price
reviews.reviewText: I love the fact that this chair is simple to put together, and after using it a couple different times it’s one of the most comfortable chairs I’ve used. I would definitely recommend it if you’re on a tight budget because it is very useful and very well made.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars This chair was poorly drilled for assembly and does not come together easily at all.
reviews.reviewText: My chair is still sitting in pieces on the floor, after making a new attempt each day for three days. The bottom (metal) comes together very easily, and it took me about ten minutes for all of it, if that. The top and seat of the chair are then held together by only the arms of the chair, by four screws, two on each side (I am not optimistic about the durability of these four screws holding a back on a chair as someone moves around and puts their weight against it to begin with. The next problem is that the four holes that attach the arms and thus hold the entire upper chair together are very poorly drilled. I tried putting the screws in the holes with the hand tool they provide and a drill, and they don't want to go in. I tried just putting the screw in the hole to see if I was getting a bad angle, but they really don't want to go in the hole without the arm between it. They seem to have been generally drilled very haphazardly, and if you don't get the exact angle, it doesn't go in. If you do get the right angle, and the pieces shift (which they almost always will, especially if you're working by yourself, as you are holding together two weighty pieces that are secured in no way, until those screws get started, then you won't be able to get the screw in; and you'll have to pull it back and find the passage again. On top of that, because the screw holes are drilled how they are, it is very easy, much easier than getting it in the socket, to get the screw to go off at an angle and just screw into the padding of the chair. I have been working on this upper for over two hours, and I've gotten one screw in (loosely, so I can still move the pieces); and I'm frankly beginning to worry that the pressure of wrestling with the chair over and over to get in the other three (or just the next one) is going to end up snapping it off on the socket.The chair shows it being able to recline and adjust a few inches, but I really see nothing on the chair that could possibly make this possible (unless their photographing the slow progress of the chair back breaking off, because it's only held by four screws that don't want to find the socket with a map and a local guide). This chair will most likely be renamed by me to be "That time I paid $50 to take something to the trash room", because without paying someone to do it, I don't think I will ever be able to get it together.I watched the video. It doesn't work. I read the reviews that said it was easy to put together, and their suggestions didn't work (and I'm wondering if they were paid now). I would return it, but after having worked in an office for years and having put together numerous desk chairs, I was sure it would be no issue and threw out the box and shipping materials. I guess, it is mine now. My millstone.To grant the star I gave it, if the pieces went together, which they don't, it would be a nice looking chair. It would be roomy. The padding seems comfortable. But it doesn't. It lays on the floor in pieces.If you ever ask why a chair costs so much less than the others, there is a reason.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Cheap but you knew
reviews.reviewText: Cheap and affordable. It was fairly easy to put together. However it is not that comfortable. The chair does lean back when you do, but when sitting, you have to sit straight up, and the “lumbar” support is far to low on the upper chair, it feels like your being pushed out of the chair. I’m going to get a back support for it, but otherwise Ok chair for the price if your not looking to spend a lot.
Although I don’t need it anymore this chair is very comfortable. Clocking in at 5’6 this chair also feels spacious too!Also fun to put together honestly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Comfortable for long periods of time, sturdy
reviews.reviewText: i bought this chair for my set up even though a lot of reviews were complaining about comfort and honestly i do not regret this purchase. its super comfortable and really cute with my set up. i would definitely recommend this chair if youre looking to have a pink set up but have a budget. on top of being cute, cheap and comfortable it also has a little massage feature which i didnt know about when i bought it but i think its pretty neat.
